intro: Knautia dinarica subsp. dinarica, commonly known as the Dinaric knautia, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats, often in mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense, spherical clusters. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
